About Us

At Fallbrook Research we're leveraging data science with quantitative finance. Applied informatics transforming market data into systematic and rules-based investment strategies. We aggregate and analyze market data to generate precise informatics that lead to actionable quantative equity strategies. Use our solutions to build and protect your wealth.

Research Areas:

  • Factor-based Equity Research
  • Beta-neutral hedging
  • Algorithmic Trade Strategies

Conducting research in empirical asset pricing and behavioral finance.

Check it out

Mission

At Fallbrook Research we're leveraging data science with quantitative finance. operational analytics for systematic investment and algorithmic trading strategies. Building on statistical and machine learning methods supported by big data with quantitative finance applications across the entire spectrum of the investment process; alpha, beta, risk management, and execution and trading. One of the most important developments in investing centers on the shift to systematic and rules-based investment strategies as compared with purely passive (index investing) to semi-passive (smart beta) to quant (factor-based) and other investment strategies. Fallbrook is engaged in data driven trends, interactive, and iterative data analysis at scale. to solve issues such as cyber security breaches and identity theft... Operational Analytics... Multicollinearity or when independent variables are highly correlated to each other then the variables are said to be multicollinear. Many types of regression techniques assumes multicollinearity should not be present in the dataset. It is because it causes problems in ranking variables based on its importance. Or it makes job difficult in selecting the most important independent variable (factor). At Fallbrook we believe that machine learning should be used to identify asset and portfolio allocations in the context of risk and performance attribution. We seek to move beyond traditional linear regression algorithms used by many quants to fit appropriate trading algorithms.
